strings:
About Reggie!
Choose an Area Area [num] You have reached the maximum amount of areas in this level.[br]Due to the game's limitations, Reggie! only allows you to add up to 4 areas to a level.
Area [num]
Area Options Tilesets Settings Timer: [b]Timer:[/b][br]Sets the countdown timer on load from the world map. It's possible to set different times for the midpoint area. Entrance ID: [b]Entrance ID:[/b][br]Sets the entrance ID to load into when loading from the World Map Wrap across Edges [b]Wrap across Edges:[/b][br]Makes the stage edges wrap[br]Warning: This option may cause the game to crash or behave weirdly. Wrapping only works correctly where the area is set up in the right way; see Coin Battle 1 for an example. Event [id] Default Events Standard Suite Stage Suite Background Suite Interactive Suite None [CUSTOM] [CUSTOM] [name] Custom filename... [name] [name] ([file]) Enter a Filename Enter the name of a custom tileset file to use. It must be placed in the game's Stage\Texture folder in order for Reggie to recognize it. Do not add the '.arc' extension at the end of the filename. Unknown Value 1: Unknown Value 2: Unknown Value 3: [b]Unknown Value 1:[/b] We haven't managed to figure out what this does, or if it does anything. [b]Unknown Value 2:[/b] We haven't managed to figure out what this does, or if it does anything. [b]Unknown Value 3:[/b] We haven't managed to figure out what this does, or if it does anything. Name File (None) Tileset (Pa[slot]):
Auto-saved backup found Reggie! has found some level data which wasn't saved - possibly due to a crash within the editor or by your computer. Do you want to restore this level?[br][br]If you pick No, the autosaved level data will be deleted and will no longer be accessible.[br][br]Original file path: [path] The level has unsaved changes in it. Do you want to save them?
Backgrounds
None 0.125x 0.25x 0.375x 0.5x 0.625x 0.75x 0.875x 1x None 1.25x 1.5x 2x 4x
Zone [num] Scenery Backdrop Position: X: [b]Position (X):[/b][br]Sets the horizontal offset of your background Y: [b]Position (Y):[/b][br]Sets the vertical offset of your background Scroll Rate: [b]Scroll Rate (X):[/b][br]Changes the rate that the background moves in[br]relation to Mario when he moves horizontally.[br]Values higher than 1x may be glitchy! [b]Scroll Rate (Y):[/b][br]Changes the rate that the background moves in[br]relation to Mario when he moves vertically.[br]Values higher than 1x may be glitchy! Zoom: [b]Zoom:[/b][br]Sets the zoom level of the background image
100% 125% 150% 200%
Preview [name] ([hex]) (Custom) Background Types:
Choose the Stage folder from [game] Error This folder doesn't have all of the files from the extracted NSMBWii Stage folder. This folder doesn't seem to have the required files. In order to use Reggie, you need the Stage folder from the game, including the Texture folder and the level files contained within it.
Are you [b]sure[/b] you want to delete this area?[br][br]The level will automatically save afterwards - there is no way[br]you can undo the deletion or get it back afterwards!
Level Diagnostics Tool This level references tilesets not used in NSMBWii. Some objects in the level are not found in the tileset files. There are sprites in this area which are known to cause NSMBWii to crash. There are sprites in this area which have settings which are known to cause NSMBWii to crash. There are too many sprites in this area. There are entrances with duplicate IDs. There is no start entrance in this area. The start entrance is too close to the left edge of the zone. An entrance is outside of a zone. There are more than 8 zones in this area. There are no zones in this area. Some zones are positioned too close together. A zone is positioned too close to the edges of this area. Some zones do not have bias enabled. Some zones are too large. This level references backgrounds not used in NSMBWii. Problems found within this area: This level is: Good No problems were found in this area, and it should load[br]correctly in the game. If you're experiencing problems,[br]try running the diagnostic again in other areas. Probably Good There are some things in this area which may[br]cause the level to crash if you're not careful.[br]If you're experiencing problems, check[br]everything on this list, and try running this test[br]in other areas. Broken Problems have been found in this area which may cause[br]it to crash in-game. These problems are listed below. Fix Selected Items... You can select multiple items at once Are you sure? Are you sure you want fix these items? This [b]cannot[/b] be undone! Fixing issues...
ID: [b]ID:[/b][br]Must be different from all other IDs Type: [b]Type:[/b][br]Sets how the entrance behaves Dest. ID: [b]Dest. ID:[/b][br]If this entrance leads nowhere or the destination is in this area, set this to 0. Dest. Area: [b]Dest. Area:[/b][br]If this entrance leads nowhere, set this to 0. Enterable [b]Enterable:[/b][br]If this box is checked on a pipe or door entrance, Mario will be able to enter the pipe/door. If it's not checked, he won't be able to enter it. Behaviour on other types of entrances is unknown/undefined. Unknown Flag [b]Unknown Flag:[/b][br]This box is checked on a few entrances in the game, but we haven't managed to figure out what it does (or if it does anything). Connected Pipe [b]Connected Pipe:[/b][br]This box allows you to enable an unused/broken feature in the game. It allows the pipe to function like the pipes in SMB3 where Mario simply goes through the pipe. However, it doesn't work correctly. Connected Pipe Reverse [b]Connected Pipe:[/b][br]This box allows you to enable an unused/broken feature in the game. It allows the pipe to function like the pipes in SMB3 where Mario simply goes through the pipe. However, it doesn't work correctly. Path ID: [b]Path ID:[/b][br]Use this option to set the path number that the connected pipe will follow. Links to Forward Pipe [b]Links to Forward Pipe:[/b][br]If this option is set on a pipe, the destination entrance/area values will be ignored - Mario will pass through the pipe and then reappear several tiles ahead, coming out of a forward-facing pipe. Layer:
Layer 1 Layer 2 Layer 0
[b]Layer:[/b][br]Allows you to change the collision layer which this entrance is active on. This option is very glitchy and not used in the default levels - for almost all normal cases, you will want to use layer 1. [b]Entrance [id]:[/b] Modify Selected Entrance Properties CP Exit Direction: [b]CP Exit Direction:[/b][br]Set the direction the player will exit out of a connected pipe.
Up Down Left Right
[b]Entrance [ent]:[/b][br]Type: [type][br][i][dest][/i] Unknown (cannot be entered) (arrives at entrance [id] in this area) (arrives at entrance [id] in area [area]) [id]: [name] (cannot be entered) at [x], [y] [id]: [name] (enterable) at [x], [y]
Warning The sprite data file didn't load correctly. The following sprites have incorrect and/or broken data in them, and may not be editable correctly in the editor: [sprites] Errors
Could not find file:[br][name]
Error An error occurred while trying to load [file].arc. Check your Texture folder to make sure it is complete and not corrupted. The editor may run in a broken state or crash after this.
Error Cannot find the required texture within the tileset file [file].arc, so it will not be loaded. Keep in mind that the tileset file cannot be renamed without changing the names of the texture/object files within the archive as well!
This file doesn't seem to be a valid level.
Error Sorry, you seem to be missing the required data files for Reggie! to work. Please redownload your copy of the editor. Sorry, you seem to be missing some of the required data files for Reggie! to work. Please redownload your copy of the editor. These are the files you are missing: [files]
Error Cannot find the required level file [file].arc. Check your Stage folder and make sure it exists.
Error Cannot find the required tileset file [file].arc. Check your Stage folder and make sure it exists.
Error Error while Reggie was trying to save the level:[br](#[err1]) [err2][br][br](Your work has not been saved! Try saving it under a different filename or in a different folder.)
Choose a level archive Level Archives All Files Choose a new filename Portable Network Graphics Compressed Level Archives
This game has custom sprite images Loading patch... New Game Patch It appears that this is your first time using the game patch for [game]. Please select its Stage folder so custom tilesets and levels can be loaded. Aborted Game Path Selection Since you did not select the stage folder for [game], stages and tilesets will not load correctly. You can try again by choosing Change Game Path while the [game] patch is loaded. New Game Patch You can change the game path for [game] at any time by choosing Change Game Path while the [game] patch is loaded. Loading sprite data... Loading background names... Reloading tilesets... Loading sprite image data... Applying sprite image data... New Super Mario Bros. Wii A new Mario adventure!
Published by Nintendo in November 2009. [i]No description[/i] Loading entrance names...
Level Information Add/Change Password This level's information is locked.[br]Please enter the password below in order to modify it. Password: Title: Author: Group: Website: Created with [name] Change Password New Password: Verify Password: Level Information Password may be composed of any ASCII character,[br]and up to 64 characters long.[br] Sorry![br][br]You can only view or edit Level Information in Area 1.
ID: [b]ID:[/b][br]Must be different from all other IDs X Pos: [b]X Pos:[/b][br]Specifies the X position of the location Y Pos: [b]Y Pos:[/b][br]Specifies the Y position of the location Width: [b]Width:[/b][br]Specifies the width of the location Height: [b]Height:[/b][br]Specifies the height of the location Snap to Grid [b]Location [id]:[/b] Modify Selected Location Properties
[id] Paint New Location
[unsaved] You're trying to paste over 300 items at once.[br]This may take a while (depending on your computer speed), are you sure you want to continue?
New Level Create a new, blank level Open Level by Name... Open a level based on its in-game world/number Open Level by File... Open a level based on its filename Recent Files Open a level from a list of recently opened levels Save Level Save the level back to the archive file Save Level As... Save a level with a new filename Level Information... Add title and author information to the level's metadata Level Screenshot... Take a full size screenshot of your level for you to share Change Game Path... Set a different folder to load the game files from Reggie! Preferences... Change important Reggie! settings Exit Reggie! Exit the editor Select All Select all items in this area Deselect Deselect all currently selected items Cut Cut out the current selection to the clipboard Copy Copy the current selection to the clipboard Paste Paste items from the clipboard Shift Items... Move all selected items by an offset Merge Locations Merge selected locations into a single large location Level Diagnostics Tool... Find and fix problems with the level Freeze Objects Make objects non-selectable Freeze Sprites Make sprites non-selectable Freeze Entrances Make entrances non-selectable Freeze Locations Make locations non-selectable Freeze Paths Make paths non-selectable Layer 0 Toggle viewing of object layer 0 Layer 1 Toggle viewing of object layer 1 Layer 2 Toggle viewing of object layer 2 Show Sprites Toggle viewing of sprites Show Sprite Images Toggle viewing of sprite images Show Locations Toggle viewing of locations Switch Grid Cycle through available grid views Zoom to Maximum Zoom in all the way Zoom In Zoom into the main level view Zoom 100% Show the level at the default zoom Zoom Out Zoom out of the main level view Zoom to Minimum Zoom out all the way Area Settings... Control tileset swapping, stage timer, entrance on load, and stage wrap Zone Settings... Zone creation, deletion, and preference editing Backgrounds... Apply backgrounds to individual zones in the current area Add New Area Add a new area (sublevel) to this level Import Area from Level... Import an area (sublevel) from another level file Delete Current Area... Delete the area (sublevel) currently open from the level Reload Tilesets Reload the tileset data files, including any changes made since the level was loaded About Reggie! Info about the program, and the team behind it Help Contents... Help documentation for the needy newbie Reggie! Tips... Tips and controls for beginners and power users About PyQt... About the Qt library Reggie! is based on Level Overview Show or hide the Level Overview window Palette Show or hide the Palette window Change Game Change the currently loaded Reggie! game patch Island Generator Show or hide the Island Generator window Stamp Pad Show or hide the Stamp Pad window Swap Objects' Tileset Swaps the tileset of objects using a certain tileset Swap Objects' Type Swaps the type of objects of a certain type Tileset Animations Play tileset animations if they exist (may cause a slowdown)
&File &Edit &View &Settings &Help Editor Toolbar
Tileset [tileset], object [obj] Object [id] Object [id][br][i]This object is animated[/i] [b]Object [id]:[/b][br][desc] [b]Object [id]:[/b][br][desc][br][i]This object is animated[/i]
Choose Level
Paint on Layer: [b]Layer 0:[/b][br]This layer is mostly used for the hidden Yoshi's Island-style caves, but can also be used to overlay tiles to create effects. The flashlight effect will occur if Mario walks behind a tile on layer 0 and the zone has it enabled. [b]Layer 1:[/b][br]All or most of your normal level objects should be placed on this layer. This is the only layer where tile interactions (solids, slopes, etc) will work. [b]Layer 2:[/b][br]Background/wall tiles (such as those in the hidden caves) should be placed on this layer. Tiles on layer 2 have no effect on collisions. View: Search: Set Default Properties Default Properties Entrances currently in this area:[br](Double-click one to jump to it instantly) Path nodes currently in this area:[br](Double-click one to jump to its first node instantly)[br]To delete a path, remove all its nodes one by one.[br]To add new paths, hit the button below and right click. Deselect (then right click for new path) Sprites currently in this area:[br](Double-click one to jump to it instantly)
Loops: [b]Loops:[/b][br]Anything following this path will wait for any delay set at the last node and then proceed back in a straight line to the first node, and continue. Speed: [b]Speed:[/b][br]Unknown unit. Mess around and report your findings! Accel: [b]Accel:[/b][br]Unknown unit. Mess around and report your findings! Delay: [b]Delay:[/b][br]Amount of time to stop here (at this node) before continuing to next node. Unit is 1/60 of a second (60 for 1 second) [b]Path [id][/b] [b]Node [id][/b] Modify Selected Path Node Properties
[b]Path ID: [path][/b][br]Node ID: [node] Path ID: [path], Node ID: [node]
Reggie! Preferences General Toolbar Themes [b]Reggie! Preferences[/b][br]Customize Reggie! by changing these settings.[br]Use the tabs below to view even more settings.[br]Reggie! must be restarted before certain changes can take effect. [b]Toolbar Preferences[/b][br]Choose menu items you would like to appear on the toolbar.[br]Reggie! must be restarted before the toolbar can be updated.[br] [b]Reggie! Themes[/b][br]Pick a theme below to change application colors and icons.[br]You can download more themes at [a href="rvlution.net"]rvlution.net[/a].[br]Reggie! must be restarted before the theme can be changed. Show the splash screen: If NSMBLib is not found (recommended) Always Never Menu format: Use the ribbon (experimental) Use the traditional menubar Language: Recent Files data: Clear All Clear All Recent Files Data Are you sure you want to delete all recent files data? This [b]cannot[/b] be undone! Current Area Reset Available Themes Preview Use Nonstandard Window Style [b]Use Nonstandard Window Style[/b][br]If this is checkable, the selected theme specifies a[br]window style other than the default. In most cases, you[br]should leave this checked. Uncheck this if you dislike[br]the style this theme uses. Options [b][name][/b][br]By [creator][br][description] Tilesets: Use Default Tileset Picker (recommended) Use Old Tileset Picker
&Home &Actions &View &Game H&elp Clipboard Freeze Level Information Area Selection Items Level Settings Areas Tilesets Layers Visibility Zoom Docks Reggie! Libraries ([shortcut]) [description] , (None) [description]
Choose a Screenshot source Current Screen All Zones Zone [zone]
Shift Items Move objects by: Enter an offset in pixels - each block is 16 pixels wide/high. Note that normal objects can only be placed on 16x16 boundaries, so if the offset you enter isn't a multiple of 16, they won't be moved correctly. X: Y: Warning You are trying to move object(s) by an offset which isn't a multiple of 16. It will work, but the objects will not be able to move exactly the same amount as the sprites. Are you sure you want to do this?
[current] (Stage [stage]) Loading layers... Loading level data... Loading tilesets... Loading objects... Preparing editor...
Modify Selected Sprite Properties [b][name][/b]: [note] [b]Sprite Notes:[/b] [notes] Modify Raw Data: Notes [b]Unidentified/Unknown Sprite ([id])[/b] [b]Sprite [id]:[br][name][/b]
[b]Sprite [type]:[/b][br][name] [name] (at [x], [y] , triggered by event [event] , triggered by events [event1]+[event2]+[event3]+[event4] , triggered by event [event1], [event2], [event3], or [event4] , activates event [event] , activates events [event1] - [event2] , activates event [event1], [event2], [event3], or [event4] , Star Coin [num] , Star Coin 1 , Coin/Set ID [id] , Movement/Coin ID [id] , Movement ID [id] , Rotation ID [id] , Location ID [id] ) Search Results No sprites found [id]: [name] Search
- 1 object selected - 1 sprite selected - 1 entrance selected - 1 location selected - 1 path node selected - [x] objects selected - [x] sprites selected - [x] entrances selected - [x] locations selected - [x] path nodes selected - [x] items selected ( , 1 object [x] objects 1 sprite [x] sprites 1 entrance [x] entrances 1 location [x] locations 1 path node [x] path nodes ) - Object under mouse: size [width]x[height] at [xpos], [ypos] on layer [layer] type [type] from tileset [tileset] - Sprite under mouse: [name] at [xpos], [ypos] - Entrance under mouse: [name] at [xpos], [ypos] [dest] - Location under mouse: Location ID [id] at [xpos], [ypos]; width [width], height [height] - Path node under mouse: Path [path], Node [node] at [xpos], [ypos] ([objx], [objy]) - ([sprx], [spry])
Classic Treeki, Tempus The default Reggie! theme. [i](unknown)[/i] [i]No description[/i]
Untitled
Zone [num]
Zones
Overworld Underground Underwater Lava/Volcano (reddish) Desert Beach* Forest* Snow Overworld* Sky/Bonus* Mountains* Tower Castle Ghost House River Cave Ghost House Exit Underwater Cave Desert Cave Icy Cave* Lava/Volcano Final Battle World 8 Castle World 8 Doomship* Lit Tower
Normal/Overworld Underground Underwater Lava/Volcano
Zone [num] New Delete Warning You are trying to add more than 8 zones to a level - keep in mind that without the proper fix to the game, this will cause your level to [b]crash[/b] or have other strange issues![br][br]Are you sure you want to do this? Dimensions X position: [b]X position:[/b][br]Sets the X Position of the upper left corner Y position: [b]Y position:[/b][br]Sets the Y Position of the upper left corner X size: [b]X size:[/b][br]Sets the width of the zone Y size: [b]Y size:[/b][br]Sets the height of the zone Preset: [b]Preset:[/b][br]Snaps the zone to common sizes.[br]The number before each entry specifies which zoom level works best with each size. Rendering and Camera Zone Theme: [b]Zone Theme:[/b][br]Changes the way models and parts of the background are rendered (for blurring, darkness, lava effects, and so on). Themes with * next to them are used in the game, but look the same as the overworld theme. Terrain Lighting: [b]Terrain Lighting:[/b][br]Changes the way the terrain is rendered. It also affects the parts of the background which the normal theme doesn't change. Normal [b]Visibility - Normal:[/b][br]Sets the visibility mode to normal. Layer 0 Spotlight [b]Visibility - Layer 0 Spotlight:[/b][br]Sets the visibility mode to spotlight. In Spotlight mode,[br]moving behind layer 0 objects enables a spotlight that[br]follows Mario around. Full Darkness [b]Visibility - Full Darkness:[/b][br]Sets the visibility mode to full darkness. In full dark mode,[br]the screen is completely black and visibility is only provided[br]by the available spotlight effect. Stars and some sprites[br]can enhance the default visibility. X Tracking: [b]X Tracking:[/b][br]Allows the camera to track Mario across the X dimension.[br]Turning off this option centers the screen horizontally in the view, producing a stationary camera mode. Y Tracking: [b]Y Tracking:[/b][br]Allows the camera to track Mario across the Y dimension.[br]Turning off this option centers the screen vertically in the view, producing very vertically limited stages. Zoom Level: [b]Zoom Level:[/b][br]Changes the camera zoom functionality[br] - Negative values: Zoom In[br] - Positive values: Zoom Out[br][br]Zoom Level 4 is rather glitchy Bias: [b]Bias:[/b][br]Sets the screen bias to the left edge on load, preventing initial scrollback.[br]Useful for pathed levels.[br]Note: Not all zoom/mode combinations support bias
Left to Right Right to Left Top to Bottom Bottom to Top
Camera Tracking: [b]Camera Tracking:[/b][br]This setting makes changes to camera tracking during multiplayer mode.[br]If the camera doesn't move, choose Left to Right.[br]If you're unsure, choose Left to Right.
Hidden On Top
[b]Visibility:[/b][br]Hidden - Mario is hidden when moving behind objects on Layer 0[br]On Top - Mario is displayed above Layer 0 at all times.[br][br]Note: Entities behind layer 0 other than Mario are never visible
Small Large Full Screen
[b]Visibility:[/b][br]Small - A small, centered spotlight affords visibility through layer 0.[br]Large - A large, centered spotlight affords visibility through layer 0[br]Full Screen - the entire screen is revealed whenever Mario walks behind layer 0
Large Foglight Lightbeam Large Focus Light Small Foglight Small Focus Light Absolute Black
[b]Visibility:[/b][br]Large Foglight - A large, organic lightsource surrounds Mario[br]Lightbeam - Mario is able to aim a conical lightbeam through use of the Wiimote[br]Large Focus Light - A large spotlight which changes size based upon player movement[br]Small Foglight - A small, organic lightsource surrounds Mario[br]Small Focuslight - A small spotlight which changes size based on player movement[br]Absolute Black - Visibility is provided only by fireballs, stars, and certain sprites Bounds Upper Bounds: [b]Upper Bounds:[/b][br] - Positive Values: Easier to scroll upwards (110 is centered)[br] - Negative Values: Harder to scroll upwards (30 is the top edge of the screen)[br][br]Values higher than 240 can cause instant death upon screen scrolling Lower Bounds: [b]Lower Bounds:[/b][br] - Positive Values: Harder to scroll downwards (65 is the bottom edge of the screen)[br] - Negative Values: Easier to scroll downwards (95 is centered)[br][br]Values higher than 100 will prevent the sceen from scrolling while Mario until Mario is offscreen Audio Background Music: [b]Background Music:[/b][br]Changes the background music Sound Modulation: [b]Sound Modulation:[/b][br]Changes the sound effect modulation
Normal Wall Echo Room Echo Double Echo Cave Echo Underwater Echo Triple Echo High Pitch Echo Tinny Echo Flat Dull Hollow Echo Rich Triple Underwater Ring Echo
Boss Flag: [b]Boss Flag:[/b][br]Set for bosses to allow proper music switching by sprites (None) Error Zoom level -2 does not support bias modes. Zoom level -1 does not support bias modes. Zoom level -1 is not supported with these Tracking modes. Set to Zoom level 0. Zoom mode 4 can be glitchy with these settings. No tracking mode is consistently glitchy and does not support bias. No tracking mode is consistently glitchy. Background Music ID: [b]Background Music ID:[/b][br]This advanced option allows custom music tracks to be loaded if the proper ASM hacks are in place. Upper Bounds 2: [b]Upper Bounds 2:[/b][br]Unknown differences from the main upper bounds. Lower Bounds 2: [b]Lower Bounds 2:[/b][br]Unknown differences from the main lower bounds. Unknown Flag [b]Unknown Flag:[/b][br]Unknown purpose. Seems to be always checked.
</strings
